business.headline: Budget 2025: Key proposals for FDs, and long-term savingsTax incentives for fixed deposits and boost middle-class savings could redefine savings strategies in Budget 2025.
GST on vouchers and gift cards: All you need to knowGift vouchers are exempt from GST, but commissions and services linked to them remain taxable under GST rules.
Sensex, Nifty fall nearly 1% as IT, banking stocks tumble in volatile day The S&P BSE Sensex plunged 720.60 points to end at 79,223.11, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 199.60 points to end at 23,989.05.

Budget 2025: 5 reforms that could make new tax regime a better deal for youThe government is expected to focus on boosting consumption, given the low GDP for the second quarter, which could lead to tax relief measures aimed at increasing disposable income for salaried taxpayers.
Budget 2025: Date, time, and what to expectThe countdown to India's Union Budget 2025 has begun, with Nirmala Sitharaman set to present key policies and reforms on February 1.

Explained: Why KPI Green Energy shares are down 36% on some trading appsKPI Green Energy stock price: The stock declined 4.44% to trade at Rs 547 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at Rs 1:40 pm after hitting an intraday low of Rs 548.

Tata Motors share price rises 4%. Is it a good time to invest?Tata Motors stock: Over the past five trading sessions, Tata Motors has gained more than 6%. However, the stock has seen a decline of 18.36% in the last six months.

Budget 2025: 5 key announcements India is waiting forBudget 2025 holds the potential to bring much-needed relief to the economy, addressing both long-term growth and immediate concerns like inflation.

ITI share price soars over 12%, hits all-time high. Know whyITI stock price: Earlier, some analysts had advised investors to book profits as it was approaching a critical resistance zone. However, it has now surpassed the resistance zone and is likely to continue its upward momentum.

Oil India, ONGC shares jump 5% today. What's fuelling the rally?The rally can be attributed to global policy measures aimed at economic revival, which investors believe could boost fuel demand and enhance earnings for upstream oil companies.

Explained: Why Jai Corp share price hit 52-week low todayThe steep decline in Jai Corp's share price over two sessions stems from a significant capital reduction proposal involving Urban Infrastructure Holdings Private Limited (UIHPL), where Jai Corp holds a 32% equity stake.

5 tax-saving tips for young professionals in 2025Proactive financial planning helps young professionals save taxes, build wealth, and reach goals with strategies like early planning, goal-based investing, and health insurance, etc.

Sensex tumbles 600 points: 3 reasons behind stock market volatilityThe downturn highlights the persistent volatility on Dalal Street, with investors uncertain about the short-term market trajectory. While auto and IT stocks had propelled a rally just a day ago, profit booking amid prevailing uncertainty appears to have weighed heavily on sentiment.

Leo Dry Fruits and Spices IPO: Check price band, GMP today  Leo Dry Fruits and Spices IPO last day: The initial public offering (IPO) of Leo Dry Fruits and Spices will close for bidding on Friday after having opened for subscription on January 1, 2025.

DMart share price jumps 14% in early trade: Should you buy?DMart share price: The stock, which closed at Rs 3,617.75 in the previous session, rose to a high of Rs 4,165.00 during intraday trading.
Sensex drops 400 points; Nifty slips below 24,100 in early tradeThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 452.52 points to 79,491.29, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 93.25 points to 24,095.40 as of 9:42 AM.

Kabeer Biswas may call it quits as Dunzo battles cash crisis: Report The Bengaluru-based quick commerce platform has faced a challenging period over the last 12–18 months, marked by cash flow issues and difficulties in raising fresh funds.

Indo Farm Equipment IPO: Check allotment status, GMP and listing dateIndo Farm IPO allotment status:: Investors who wish to check Indo Farm Equipment IPO allotment can do so by visiting the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) website and the registrar's online portal, which is Mas Services Limited.

Can unregistered small businesses receive GST notices?The annual turnover threshold for GST registration is Rs 40 lakh for businesses supplying goods and Rs 20 lakh for service providers. Businesses below these limits are exempt, but exceeding them triggers registration and compliance requirements.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Dense fog blinds north India, over 250 flights impacted in Delhi, trains hitA dense fog amid a cold wave disrupted flights, trains, and road traffic across north India, delaying over 150 flights, cancelling 30 at Delhi Airport, and causing widespread inconvenience.
I stood down: Rohit Sharma breaks silence on missing Sydney TestRohit Sharma has revealed that he decided to step down for the Sydney Test to make way for an in-form player to come into the side.

Trump to be sentenced in hush money case on Jan 10, a week before taking officeUS President-elect Donald Trump will be required to appear at a court hearing in a case involving hush money paid to a porn star.

5th Test, Day 2 Live: Prasidh sends Carey back in the hut post lunchIndia (IND) vs Australia (AUS) 5th Test, Day 2 Live Updates, Reactions: India have struck post lunch as they got the big wicket of Alex Carey with Praisdh Krishna shattering his stumps from around the wicket. Carey and Beau Webster got involved in a good partnership post lunch for Australia as the duo is tried to whittle away the deficit from India's first innings. Earlier, India had a terrific morning session where they claimed 4 wickets.

How a timely tissue paper note helped India clinch nuclear deal with USThe 2005 agreement between PM Manmohan Singh and US President George W Bush, which paved the way for the landmark 2008 India-US Civil Nuclear Deal, hit a deadlock just hours before it was to be signed. At this critical juncture, a two-sentence note from Anil Kakodkar, Chairman of the AEC, to PM Manmohan Singh proved instrumental in breaking the impasse and sealing the historic pact.

Journalist found dead in Chhattisgarh days after report on road project corruptionMukesh had been missing since the night of January 1. His elder brother, Yukesh Chandrakar, filed a missing person report after Mukesh's phone remained switched off following a meeting arranged by contractor Suresh Chandrakar's brother, Ritesh.

Not retiring: Rohit confirms Test future after stepping down from SCG TestIndia captain Rohit Sharma provided clarity on his Test future after stepping down from the Sydney Test match. The India captain confirmed that he was not retiring from Test cricket and only skipped this Test due to poor form.

Suchir Balaji's backup drive on OpenAI testimony missing: US journalist George WebbGeorge Webb ruled out the possibility that Suchir Balaji's death could've been due to a random act of violence, stating that nothing of value, including his laptop and phone, were missing. He, however, claimed that OpenAI might not be behind Balaji's death.

AUS vs IND: Jasprit Bumrah breaks 46-year-old Indian Test record in AustraliaIndia fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah broke the 46-year-old record of legendary India spinner Bishan Singh Bedi as he registered the most wickets by  an Indian bowler in a Test series in Australia.

Sourav Ganguly's daughter Sana escapes unhurt after bus hits her car in KolkataThe accident took place when the Kolkata to Raichak bus hit Sana's car from behind in Behala Chowrasta area. Sana Ganguly was inside the car, which was being driven by her driver.

Parental consent must for children's accounts: Centre in draft social media rulesAs per the draft rules, companies will need government permission to transfer personal data outside India and children below 18 years will require parental consent for creating accounts on social media.

Mike Johnson reelected as US House Speaker by thin margin after Republican's supportMike Johnson appeared to initially fall short of the majority he needed to retain his job in a roll-call vote that lasted nearly two hours, but two Republican opponents switched their votes to support him after lengthy negotiations.

BAFTA 2025 longlist: All We Imagine As Light gets three nodsPayal Kapadia's film All We Imagine As Light is longlisted for three BAFTA 2025 awards, including Best Director and Best Film not in English language, following its Golden Globes nominations.

Decomposed body of woman found inside bed in Delhi, husband on the runThe Delhi Police recovered the decomposed body of a 24-year-old woman stuffed inside a bed in her rented accommodation in the city's Dabri area. A probe has been launched into the incident.

UK hits back at 'misinformed' Elon Musk on child abuse grooming gangsElon Musk has been severely critical of the British government's handling of young girls' sexual exploitation across several towns and cities in England more than a decade ago, in many cases involving gangs of Pakistani-origin men.

Fresh violence in Manipur, top district official's office attacked in KangpokpiA fresh bout of violence occurred in Manipur's Kangpokpi after a mob stormed and attacked a Deputy Commissioner's office as the situation remained extremely tense.

David Schwimmer recalls 'genuinely frightening moment' featuring Matt LeBlancFriends actor David Schwimmer shared a scary moment on Friends set when his co-star, Matt LeBlanc, dislocated his shoulder during a live taping.

Tesla Cybertruck explosion: How the EV saved livesWhile a significant amount of the blast was contained within the Tesla Cybertruck, the remainder went up through the bed's roof instead of getting out from the sides.

Pakistan will need quick breakthroughs tomorrow to prevent further damage and stay in the contest.

Chess champion Koneru Humpy thrilled after meeting PM Modi: Incredible honourChess champion Koneru Humpy described meeting Prime Minister Narendra Modi as an "incredible honour" after her historic win at the 2024 FIDE Women's World Rapid Championship. The meeting marked a significant moment of recognition for her exceptional achievement.

India can still give Australia run for their money in SCG Test: GavaskarIndian cricket legend Sunil Gavaksar believes that despite India's batting struggles on Day 1 opf the Sydney Test, the Jasprit Bumrah-led side can still pose a big threat to Australia for the match. India's top-order continued to struggle against Australia even after Rohit Sharma was rested for the match.

Djokovic handed quarterfinal exit by Opelka in Brisbane InternationalReilly Opelka stunned Novak Djokovic in the Brisbane International quarterfinals, serving 16 aces to secure a 7-6(6), 6-3 victory, marking one of the biggest wins of his career and setting up a semifinal clash against Giovanni Mpetshi Perricard.

Video: Daniel Sams, Cameron Bancroft hospitalised after nasty collision in BBLDaniel Sams and Cameron Bancroft were rushed to the hospital after they collided head-on during a Big Bash League game in Perth on January 3. The Thunder said both players were conscious, demonstrating symptoms of concussion and have possible fractures

Scrutiny a constant, X-factor Rishabh Pant now crafting Pant 2.0Rishabh Pant's gritty knock in the Sydney Test highlighted his evolving approach, balancing natural flair with situational awareness after criticism over rash dismissals in Melbourne. Battling against the Australian pacers and his own instincts, Pant hit a crucial 40 in the first innings in Sydney.

SA vs PAK 2nd Test: Ryan Rickelton becomes 1st Test centurion of 2025 Ryan Rickelton started 2025 in style, smashing a brilliant century against Pakistan in the New Year's Test at Newlands, Cape Town. Notably, Rickelton has always converted fifty-plus scores into hundreds, continuing his remarkable Test cricket journey.

Make Konstas come for a tour of India: Aakash Chopra after batter's SCG anticsAakash Chopra hinted that Australian youngster Sam Konstas might struggle on a Test tour to India, following his fiery exchanges with Jasprit Bumrah during the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Chopra believes India's conditions will expose Konstas's weaknesses despite his stellar debut series.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
